headline.print_headline: Designers Set Sail, Turning to Wind to Help Power Cargo Ships
headline.seo: Cargo Ship Designers Turn to Wind to Cut Cost and Emissions
headline.main: Designers Set Sail, Turning to Wind to Help Power Cargo Ships

docs.snippet: To reduce emissions and conserve expensive fossil fuels, cargo ship designers are turning to the oldest source of power there is: the wind....
docs.abstract: Cargo ship designers are returning to the age-old principle of wind power in order to reduce carbon emissions by the world's shipping fleet; new vessels make use of modern design principals and materials, and bear little resemblance to their centuries-old predecessors.
docs.lead_paragraph: To reduce emissions and conserve expensive fossil fuels, cargo ship designers are turning to the oldest source of power there is: the wind.

headline.print_headline: Germans at Central Banks in Policy Rift
headline.main: German at European Central Bank at Odds With Country’s Policy Makers

docs.snippet: The top German official at the European Central Bank defended its plans to intervene in bond markets as a way of lowering borrowing costs for business....
docs.abstract: Jorg Asmussen, top German official at European Central Bank, defends its plans to intervene in bond markets as a way of lowering borrowing costs for business and encouraging economic growth; position puts him at odds with Germany's central bank president Jens Weidmann and highlights a growing split in country's policy-making elite.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The top German official at the European Central Bank defended its plans to intervene in bond markets as a way of lowering borrowing costs for business.

headline.print_headline: To Preserve Regional Tradition, Flanders Subsidizes Horse Breeding
headline.seo: To Preserve Tradition, Flanders Subsidizes Horse Breeding
headline.main: To Preserve Regional Tradition, Flanders Subsidizes Horse Breeding

docs.snippet: In less than a century, Belgian draft horses have gone from being one of the country's most valuable exports to a vanishing breed in their own homeland....
docs.lead_paragraph: In less than a century, Belgian draft horses have gone from being one of the country's most valuable exports to a vanishing breed in their own homeland.

headline.print_headline: President Of Myanmar Reshuffles His Cabinet
headline.main: President of Myanmar Reshuffles His Cabinet

docs.snippet: In a move that could consolidate his power, President Thein Sein put his closest allies in crucial positions and sidelined at least one hard-line minister left over from the days of military rule....
docs.abstract: President Thein Sein of Myanmar announces a major cabinet reshuffle that appears to centralize the power of his office, put his closest allies in crucial government positions and sideline at least one hard-line minister left over from the days of military rule; changes have the potential to consolidate the president’s power at a time when crucial laws on foreign investment and the media are being debated.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a move that could consolidate his power, President Thein Sein put his closest allies in crucial positions and sidelined at least one hard-line minister left over from the days of military rule.

headline.print_headline: More Than One Kind of Partner for a Supernova
headline.seo: White Dwarf Can Pair With Red Giant for Supernova
headline.main: More Than One Kind of Partner for a Supernova

docs.snippet: Scientists studying a Type 1a supernova found it to be caused by a white dwarf absorbing gas from a nearby red giant....
docs.abstract: Dr Benjamin Dilday study in journal Science finds that red giant stars can cause supernovas after being absorbed by white dwarf stars; researchers hope the finding will help classify supernovas with greater precision.
docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists studying a Type 1a supernova found it to be caused by a white dwarf absorbing gas from a nearby red giant.

headline.seo: How Video Games Could Improve Our Vision
headline.main: How Video Games Could Improve Our Vision

docs.snippet: Dr. Maurer has conducted research that suggests that “first-person shooter” video games can improve the sight of people with visual impairment....
docs.abstract: Interview with developmental psychologist Dr Daphne Maurer, whose research suggests that people with visual impairment can improve their sight by playing 'first-person shooter' video games.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Maurer has conducted research that suggests that “first-person shooter” video games can improve the sight of people with visual impairment.

headline.print_headline: Satellites Show Sea Ice in Arctic Is at a Record Low
headline.seo: Sea Ice in Arctic Measured at Record Low
headline.main: Satellites Show Sea Ice in Arctic Is at a Record Low

docs.snippet: With weeks left to go in the melting season, scientists are investigating whether a decline of ice in the Arctic Ocean is contributing to extreme weather farther south....
docs.abstract: National Snow and Ice Data Center, a government-sponsored research agency, announces that the amount of sea ice in the Arctic has fallen to the lowest level on record, a confirmation of the drastic warming in the region and a likely harbinger of larger changes to come; most scientists believe that trend is primarily a consequence of the human release of greenhouse gases.
docs.lead_paragraph: With weeks left to go in the melting season, scientists are investigating whether a decline of ice in the Arctic Ocean is contributing to extreme weather farther south.

headline.print_headline: Bacteria From Humans Are Found in Chimps
headline.seo: Drug-Resistant Human Strains of Staph Bacteria Are Found in Chimps
headline.main: Drug-Resistant Bacteria Is Found in Chimpanzees

docs.snippet: Scientists are concerned that chimpanzees that are cared for in sanctuaries and then released may spread harmful strains of Staphylococcus aureus to wild chimps....
docs.abstract: Study in The American Journal of Primatology reports that chimpanzees in African sanctuaries harbor human strains of the bacterium Staphylococcus aureus; scientists worry that some human strains are particularly pathogenic and could be harmful if spread to wild chimpanzees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists are concerned that chimpanzees that are cared for in sanctuaries and then released may spread harmful strains of Staphylococcus aureus to wild chimps.

headline.print_headline: Learning Doesn’t Stop When You’re Asleep
headline.seo: Study Shows Learning of Smells and Sounds in Sleep
headline.main: Learning Doesn’t Stop When You’re Asleep

docs.snippet: People can form new associations between scents and sounds in their sleep, according to a new study....
docs.abstract: Anat Arzi study in journal Nature Neuroscience finds that human beings can learn new associations between scents and sounds in their sleep; researchers hope to find practical uses for the study's findings, like conditioning people to change bad habits.
docs.lead_paragraph: People can form new associations between scents and sounds in their sleep, according to a new study.

headline.seo: Why Do Some Roses Wither While Some Blooms Turn Into Rose Hips?

docs.snippet: Some breeds of roses are better at producing hips than others, experts say....
docs.abstract: Science Q&A on why some rose blooms simply wither while others morph into rose hips.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some breeds of roses are better at producing hips than others, experts say.
